title: Net zero and insurance underwriting - PwC
summary: To meet climate goals and avoid catastrophic climate change, it is crucial to drastically reduce emissions in the next decade. Investments in solutions with high near-term abatement potential are essential. Insurers face both transition risks and opportunities as industries transition to greener alternatives.

title: 5 Key Elements of Locus AG's CarbonNOW Program - No-Till Farmer
summary: The Get Confident in Carbon program from Locus AG offers carbon payments to farmers. The program includes third-party soil sampling to ensure accuracy and a grower data portal for easy use.  No-till farmers can use the Locus AG soil probiotics to qualify for the CarbonNOW program, which offers a high ROI, guaranteed payments, and performance bonuses.  The program is designed to be accessible to farmers and includes a grower data portal for easy use.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes a program that can qualify as green innovation because it helps reduce or replace harmful substances

green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a specific process with significant differences compared to previous processes offered by the company in terms of greater efficacy, resource efficiency, or reliability and resilience.

title: HYCO1 and Kansas Ethanol Collaborate on World's Largest Biogenic CO2 Utilization Facility - PR Newswire
summary: HYCO1 has announced a partnership with Kansas Ethanol to build the world's largest biogenic carbon dioxide utilization facility. The facility will utilize carbon dioxide from Kansas Ethanol's production process to create low-carbon and zero-carbon products such as synthetic base oils and low-carbon jet fuel. The HYCO1 technology used in the project enables the production of sustainable products with significantly reduced carbon footprints compared to traditional fossil-derived products.
green_innovation: TRUE, the HYCO1 technology used in the project enables the production of sustainable products with significantly reduced carbon footprints compared to traditional fossil-derived products, and reduces negative environmental externalities by converting industrial scale CO2 emissions into low carbon intensity syngas and green chemicals.
business_innovation: TRUE, the HYCO1 technology is a new and improved business process for the production of low-carbon and zero-carbon products from carbon dioxide emissions, differing significantly from previous business processes and offering greater efficacy, resource efficiency, and environmental sustainability.
green_product: TRUE, the synthetic base oils and low-carbon jet fuel produced by the HYCO1 technology are green products as they are designed and manufactured to significantly reduce their environmental impact throughout their life cycle, utilizing environmentally benign materials and sustainable production processes.
green_process: TRUE, the HYCO1 technology is a green process as it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by converting carbon dioxide emissions into low-carbon and zero-carbon products, reducing waste, conserving natural resources, and decreasing energy consumption.
likely_naics_codes: ['325110 - Petrochemical Manufacturing', '325211 - Plastics Material and Resin Manufacturing', '325510 - Paint and Coating Manufacturing', '562210 - Waste Treatment and Disposal']
greenwashing: FALSE, the HYCO1 technology and the products it enables are not an example of greenwashing, as the environmental benefits of the technology and products are substantiated and not exaggerated or misleading.

title: REPLENISH NUTRIENTS ANNOUNCES $7 MILLION IN NON-DILUTIVE FUNDING - Canada NewsWire
summary: Replenish Nutrients Ltd., a subsidiary of EarthRenew Inc., has been awarded a $7 million grant from Emissions Reductions Alberta (ERA) to construct a regenerative fertilizer manufacturing facility near Debolt, Alberta. The facility is expected to produce up to 50,000 metric tons of regenerative fertilizer per year, which will replace traditional synthetic fertilizers and contribute to reduced greenhouse gas emissions and increased carbon sequestration in soil.
